Posts.Content: i received the following in an email - i thought it was one of those crap emails, but i tested my own lipsticks on my hand and i did get a black streak on my hand from all of them!! >Subject: >Serious: Lipstick alert !! >Subject: Lipstick Alert!!! > You might just want to stop wearing lipstick>  This comes from someone who works in the breast cancer unit at Mt.Sinai Hospital , in Toronto . From: Dr. Nahid Neman   If there is a female you care anything about, share this with her. I did!!!!!  Recently a lipstick brand called "Red Earth" decreased their prices From $67 to $9.90.ÃÂ  It contained lead. Lead is a chemical which causes cancer. Posts.Title: Interesting reading - FYI

Posts.Content: yes, i have heard that. and when i think back i remember that while i worked at the other place i used to have this weird throbbing pain in my right breast and guess where they found the cancer....right breast. it does feel sooo good to work with friends - i don't even miss the extra bonus money i used to make, not even a little bit. we are both very lucky to work with angels!! :-) kat
Posts.Title: Supplements?? What should we do??

Posts.Content: that's good that you do all that - there is sooo much info out there it's hard to say what is good and what isn't. i also don't want to deal with all of this again - twice was enough!! :-) i do add alot more veggies & fruit to my diet than i used to eat. i also think that stress had alot to do with my illness - when i got it in 2004, i was working at a place that was horrible - the people there are awful, management is just plain evil and the pressure there was tremendous. i got laid off in august and diagnosed in september. at the time i had a real big case of the why me's but now i see that losing that job was the best thing - i didn't have to worry about the hassle i would have gotten trying to get time off for surgery, dr appts and treatments. now i am working in a small company with the most wonderful people. i can't believe how lucky i was to find this job - a little less money, but ALOT less stress!! :-) kat
Posts.Title: Supplements?? What should we do??

Posts.Content: wow, you do alot! i take a multi (centrum silver - it has more anti-oxidents), a b complex, essential oils, coq10 and calcium. your diet is alot stricter than mine - i low carb and i eat meat almost every day. red, white, fish, whatever. i also try to have an apple and some red grapes everyday. i put peanut butter on the apples - i read that peanuts have reservatol like the grapes do. i try to have more chicken than red meat because of the fat. i found some pretty good soy chips - i have them a few days a week. i also put a green tea extract in one bottle of water a day.
Posts.Title: Supplements?? What should we do??

Posts.Content: they told me not to shave and to use a natural deodorant, but i just did things as usual. i did have some peeling under the breast from the radiation. and the doctor said it was also because i was still wearing underwire bras (but they're so pretty!!). i put pure aloe lotion on mine and it cleared up pretty quickly. i didn't have a break in the radiation, though. hugs!! kat
